channel.title: Comments on: Melomakarona – Walnut Syrup Biscuits

item.title: By: Pauline
item.dc:creator: Pauline
item.description: One of my favourite Greek sweets! I started baking it last year but I must admit that yours look delicious! I have also tried to half cover them in chocolate, it makes them even naughtier!
item.content:encoded: One of my favourite Greek sweets! I started baking it last year but I must admit that yours look delicious! I have also tried to half cover them in chocolate, it makes them even naughtier!

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description: Thanks to everyone for your comments, I agree that the oil to flour ratio does make me feel better about the quantity of oil used. The flavours are lovely and the sweet syrup is gorgeous, it's like biscuits and baklava mixed together.
item.content:encoded: Thanks to everyone for your comments, I agree that the oil to flour ratio does make me feel better about the quantity of oil used. The flavours are lovely and the sweet syrup is gorgeous, it’s like biscuits and baklava mixed together.

item.title: By: Howard
item.dc:creator: Howard
item.description: These look great, reminds me of the sweets you see at the middle eastern grocery stores!
item.content:encoded: These look great, reminds me of the sweets you see at the middle eastern grocery stores!

item.title: By: Julia @ MÃ©langer
item.dc:creator: Julia @ MÃ©langer
item.description: Oh yummo!! These looked great. I don't seem to be scared off with cups of butter or oil in sweet food, but for some reason it scares me in savoury food. Go figure?
item.content:encoded: Oh yummo!! These looked great. I don’t seem to be scared off with cups of butter or oil in sweet food, but for some reason it scares me in savoury food. Go figure?

item.title: By: Yasmin (Almond & The Hazelnut)
item.dc:creator: Yasmin (Almond & The Hazelnut)
item.description: How interesting - when I first begun baking, it was the opposite for me! What's a cup of oil, I thought, it's just liquid right? :) But I do love baking with oil, particularly in carrot, banana or spice cakes, the resulting texture so moist. I can't recall having used them in biscuits yet... hmmm, looks pretty inviting!
item.content:encoded: How interesting – when I first begun baking, it was the opposite for me! What’s a cup of oil, I thought, it’s just liquid right? ðŸ™‚ But I do love baking with oil, particularly in carrot, banana or spice cakes, the resulting texture so moist. I can’t recall having used them in biscuits yet… hmmm, looks pretty inviting!

item.title: By: Belle@OohLook
item.dc:creator: Belle@OohLook
item.description: You always come up with the most delicious recipes. I probably wouldn't think to make these, but after seeing your photos, I'll give it a try!
item.content:encoded: You always come up with the most delicious recipes. I probably wouldn’t think to make these, but after seeing your photos, I’ll give it a try!

item.title: By: Forager
item.dc:creator: Forager
item.description: Wow you're such a proficient cook & baker! Especially love that photo with the oil too. Thosen oil droplets look like a liquid honeycomb structure
item.content:encoded: Wow you’re such a proficient cook & baker! Especially love that photo with the oil too. Thosen oil droplets look like a liquid honeycomb structure

item.title: By: Sophia
item.dc:creator: Sophia
item.description: oh my god! these look absolutely fantastic....sticky and crunchy and nutty!
item.content:encoded: oh my god! these look absolutely fantastic….sticky and crunchy and nutty!

item.title: By: Maria@TheGourmetChallenge
item.dc:creator: Maria@TheGourmetChallenge
item.description: They look so wonderful and cute. I think the cup of oil is more than justified judging from your results. I especially love the photo with the oil droplets forming on the top of the bowl.
item.content:encoded: They look so wonderful and cute. I think the cup of oil is more than justified judging from your results. I especially love the photo with the oil droplets forming on the top of the bowl.

item.title: By: Lorraine @ Not Quite Nigella
item.dc:creator: Lorraine @ Not Quite Nigella
item.description: These look fabulous Anita and just like the ones I've tried :) I've always wondered how to make them. I should have known that Taste would have the answer.
item.content:encoded: These look fabulous Anita and just like the ones I’ve tried ðŸ™‚ I’ve always wondered how to make them. I should have known that Taste would have the answer.
